Subjects: Arthur, prince of Wales; occasional verse; Coventry
_description: ‘Balet song at þe Crosse’ in welcome of Prince Arthur at Coventry (1498) — three 8-line tail-rhyme stanzas

CovLeet.Last Lines:
…And vertue ay spredyngto your lyfes
                    yend
